question.content: In which of the following cities has India's first underwater train project been launched?

solution.content: Kolkata. Underwater train project: It is part of the Kolkata Metro's East-West Corridor. The underwater section of the tunnel passes under the Hooghly River.

question.content: Who was the first defence minister of India?

solution.content: Sardar Baldev Singh. First Cabinet of Free India 1947:- Jawaharlal Nehru (Prime Minister: External Affairs & Commonwealth Relations, Scientific Research), Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel (Home Minister, Information And Broadcasting, States), Dr. Rajendra Prasad (Food And Agriculture), Maulana Abul Kalam Azad (Education), Dr. John Mathai (Railways And Transport), R.K Shanmugham Chetty (Finance), Dr. BR Ambedkar (Law), Jagjivan Ram (Labour), C.H. Bhabha (Commerce), Raj Kumari Amrit Kaur (Health), Rafi Ahmed Kidwai (Communication), Dr. Shyam Prasad Mukherji (Industries And Supplies), V.N Gadgil (Works, Mines & Power).

question.content: Who was the first president of 1OA?

solution.content: Sir Dorabji Tata. Indian Olympic Association (IOA): It is a body for selecting athletes to represent India at the Olympic Games, Asian Gaimes and other international athletic meets. It was formed in 1927 in Delhi. PT Usha was the first woman President of the IOA. Some tasks of this association Sending teams to the Olympics, Securing Funds, Holding National Games.

question.content: Who among the following was the first president of the IOC?

solution.content: Demetrius Vikelas. The International Olympic Committee (IOC): Founded: 23 June 1894, Headquarters: Lausanne (Switzerland). The first Olympic games were held on 6 April 1896 in Athens. India first participated in the Olympics in 1900 in Paris. Pierre de Coubertin (second president 10С).

question.content: When was the first World Weightlifting Championship organized by the World Weightlifting Federation in London, UK?

solution.content: March 1891 - Only Men's competition. The first World Weightlifting Championships for women took place in the United States in 1987. International Weightlifting Federation (IWF) founded in 1905. Indian Weightlifting Federation formed in 1935.

question.content: In which of the following years was the first radio show broadcast in India?

solution.content: 1923. The Radio Club of Bombay made the first-ever broadcast in the country in June 1923. The Indian Broadcasting Company (IBC) came into being on 23 July 1927. All India Radio: Founded 1936, Headquarters Akashvani Bhavan building in New Delhi. Prasar Bharti: Founded 23 November 1997, Headquarters - New Delhi.

question.content: Which of the following airports is India's first to be completely powered by solar energy?

solution.content: Cochin International Airport (CIAL), Kerala. Other Indian Airports: Indira Gandhi International Airport (Delhi), Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport (Mumbai), Kempegowda International Airport (Bengaluru), Rajiv Gandhi International Airport (Hyderabad). World's busiest airport (in passenger terms) Atlanta's Hartsfield-Jackson international airport.

question.content: Which of the following is India's first all-women-managed railway station?

solution.content: Gandhinagar Railway Station, Jaipur. Matunga Railway Station, Mumbai is also managed by all women crew in the sub-urban category. Surekha Yadav became the country's first female train driver in 1988, also Asia's first female locomotive pilot.

question.content: Who was appointed as the first woman Vice-Chancellor of Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU), New Delhi?

solution.content: Santishree Pandit. Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) was established 1969 by an act of parliament. G. Parthasarathy was the First Vice-Chancellor.

question.content: The first Paralympic games were held in which year?

solution.content: 1960. The first Paralympic Games Rome (Italy). First winter Paralympics Games - Sweden (1976).

question.content: Who was behind publishing the first Newspaper in India?

solution.content: James Augustus Hickey- Bengal Gazette was published in Calcutta in 1780. It was a weekly English newspaper started by an Irishman. Udant Martand (The Rising Sun) The first Hindi-language weekly newspaper published on May 30, 1826 from Calcutta by Pt. Jugal Kishore Shukla.

question.content: Who among the following was the first Chief Election Commissioner of India?

solution.content: Sukumar Sen. Dr. Nagendra Singh - The First Indian to be the President of the International Court of Justice from the year 1985 to 1988. KVK Sundaram- Second Chief Election Commissioner of India.

question.content: The first Women's Cricket World Cup was hosted by which of the following countries?

solution.content: England. Women Cricket World Cup: 1973 (first edition) England (Winner), 2022 NewZealand (Host), Australia (Winner), ICC Women's T20 World Cup 2024 (Bangladesh), ICC Women's T20 World Cup 2026 (England), ICC Women's Cricket World Cup 2025 (India), ICC Women's T20 Champions Trophy 2027 (Sri Lanka).

question.content: When did India win the first World Cup title in Hockey?

solution.content: 1975. India defeated Pakistan under the Captaincy of Ajit Pal Singh in 3rd edition of Hockey World Cup. Hosted by (Malaysia). India has won 8 Gold medals in Olympics hockey six of them in a row (from 1928-1956) and added two more at Tokyo (1964) and Moscow (1980).

question.content: Which was the first petrochemical company in India?

solution.content: National Organic Chemical Industry Limited: It was established in 1961. Other companies and their founding years: Gas Authority of India Limited (GAIL) 1984. Haldia Petrochemicals Limited 1985. Dr V. Krishnamurthy is known as the 'Father of Public Sector Undertakings' in India.

question.content: Which state had the first female Governor in independent India?

solution.content: Uttar Pradesh (Sarojini Naidu). First female in India : President Pratibha Patil; Prime minister Indira Gandhi; Chief minister - Sucheta Kriplani (UP); Defense minister Nirmala Sitharaman.

question.content: Who among the following became the first Indian to be invited to perform at the prestigious Lincoln Centre Hall in the United States of America?

solution.content: Bismillah Khan:- He played the shehnai on 15 August 1947 at the Red Fort. He was the first Indian to greet the nation with his musical instrument.

question.content: The President of which country attended the first Republic Day celebrations of India as its chief guest?

solution.content: Indonesia (President Sukarno). Between 1950 and 1954, Republic Day parades were held at Irwin Stadium (now National Stadium), Kingsway, Red Fort and Ramlila Maidan. King Tribhuvan Bir Bikram Shah of Nepal - Second Chief Guest of the Republic Day Parade in 1951.

question.content: Who among the following served as the first Chief Justice of India? SSC CHSL Tier-226/06/2023

solution.content: Hiralal Jekisundas Kania. The Supreme Court (Article 124) was established at Calcutta as a court of record through the Regulating Act of 1773. Now, It comprises the Chief Justice and not more than 33 other judges.

question.content: Which among the following is India's first Human spaceflight programme?

solution.content: Gaganyaan It envisages demonstration of human spaceflight capability. It will be launched at the end of 2023 or in 2024. Mars Orbiter Mission (MOM, Mangalyaan): Launch vehicle PSLV-C25, Date 5 November 2013. Chandrayaan-1 (India's first moon mission): Launched on 22 October 2008. Place SDSC SHAR (Sriharikota). Chandrayaan-2: Launched on 22 July 2019. Launch vehicle GSLV Mk III-M1. Chandrayaan - 3: Launched on - 14 July 2023. Launch vehicle - LVM3 M4.

question.content: Which is the first garden - tomb in the Indian subcontinent?

solution.content: Humayun's Tomb (Maqbara-i Humayun). It is situated in Delhi. It was designed by Mirak Mirza Ghiyas and his son Sayyid Muhammed. In 1993, it was declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

question.content: Who was the first Indian actress to receive the Padma Shri Award?

solution.content: Nargis Dutt: She was an Indian actress and politician who worked in Hindi cinema. Padma Shri (1958). First recipient of Padma Shri - K. Shankar Pillai - 1954 (Literature & Education), Balbir Singh- 1957 (sports), Asha Devi Aryanayakam 1954 (Public Affairs), Bir Bhan Bhatia - 1954 (Medicine).

question.content: Which state government has introduced India's first elephant death audit framework?  (Afternoon

solution.content: Tamil Nadu. India's first elephant death audit framework: Introduced in 2022. The framework aims to improve transparency and accountability in the management of elephant deaths in the state.

question.content: India participated in the Olympic Games for the first time in  (Afternoon

solution.content: 1900. Athlete Norman Pritchard represented India at the Paris Olympics.

question.content: Who was the first Indian Army officer to be promoted to the rank of field marshal?

solution.content: Sam Manekshaw: Chief of the Army Staff of the Indian Army during the Indo-Pakistani War of 1971. Field Marshal is a five-star General officer rank and the highest attainable rank in the Indian Army. KM Cariappa: First Indian Commander -in-Chief of the Indian Army. Vikram Batra: Martyr of Kargil war, Param Vir Chakra (1999).

question.content: Who was the first woman of Indian origin to go to space?

solution.content: Kalpana Chawla

question.content: Who was the first Indian woman to be appointed Chief Justice of a state High Court?

solution.content: Leila Seth. In 1991, she became the first female judge to be appointed as a Chief Justice of a state high court, Himachal Pradesh High court. Anna Chandy was India's first female judge and the first woman in the country to become a High court judge. M Fathima Beevi was the first woman judge to the Supreme Court as well as the first Muslim woman judge there. Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw is the founder of Biocon Ltd.

question.content: Who was the first Indian to get the Oscar for lifetime achievements in cinema in 1992?

solution.content: Satyajit Ray was the first Indian who received such an award from the Academy of Motion Pictures, Arts and Science. Awards - Dadasaheb Phalke Award (1984), Bharat Ratna (1992). Рadma Shri (1958), Padma Bhushan (1965), JLCCA Ramon Magsaysay Award (1967), Padma Vibhushan (1976) etc.

question.content: Flight Lieutenant had created history in May 2019 by becoming the first woman to qualify for combat missions on a fighter jet.

solution.content: Bhawana Kanth. Priya Jinghan: The First Lady Cadet to join the Indian Army Officer. Harita Kaur Deol:The first Indian woman to fly solo in an Avro HS-748 aircraft. Shanti Tigga: She was the first female jawan in the Indian Army.

question.content: Indian Army's 1st women combat aviator is

solution.content: Abhilasha Barak. The Army Aviation Corps is a form of the Army that was formed in November 1986. Punita Arora was the first woman Lieutenant General of the Indian Army. She held the ranks of Lieutenant General in the Indian Army and Surgeon Vice Admiral in the Navy. Divya Ajit Kumar is the first woman to be conferred by the Army with the Sword of Honour.

question.content: Which of the following has become the first state in the country to get the L-root server?

solution.content: Rajasthan {(At the Bhamashah State Data Centre in association with the Internet Corporation for Assigned Names and Numbers (ICANN)}. There are at present three Domain Name System (DNS) root servers: J-root servers and Two L-root servers.

question.content: Who among the following has become IAF's first woman fighter pilot from J&K?

solution.content: Mawya Sudan. First female combat pilots commissioned in the IAF in 2016: Avani Chaturvedi (became first woman fighter pilot of India), Bhawana Kanth, and Mohana Singh. In 2015, the Government of India opened up the combat roles to women in the Indian Air Force (IAF) on an experimental basis for five years. First woman pilot of India (Sarla Thakral).

question.content: The first regional rural bank set up in India was

solution.content: Prathama Grameen Bank was set up on October 2, 1975. Owner- Government of India (50%), Nationalised Banks (35%), State Governments (15%).

question.content: The first playback song in Hindi Movies was recorded by music directors RC Boral and Pankaj Mullick in which year?

solution.content: 1935, for the Nitin Bose-directed film, Dhoop Chhaon, by music directors RC Boral and Pankaj Mullick (Main khush hona chahun, sung by Suprava Sarkar, Parul Ghosh and Uma Shashi Devi).

question.content: Who among the following was the first Indian Governor of Reserve Bank of India?

solution.content: CD Deshmukh. RBI was established on 1 April 1935. The headquarter of RBI is in Mumbai. The Reserve Bank of India was set up on the basis of the recommendations of the 'Hilton Young Commission'.

question.content: , the world's first sailing boat made entirely from plastic waste, aims to raise people's awareness of plastic pollution in oceans.

solution.content: Flipflopi An East African movement with a mission to end single use plastic and inspire a plastic-reuse revolution through our innovation hubs, positive storytelling and education, and campaigning to influence policy change.

question.content: Where was the first jute mill set up at Kolkata in 1859?

solution.content: Rishra. The mill was set up on the riverbank of Hooghly in Kolkata. The jute spinning machinery was brought by George Acland from Dundee.

question.content: Who among the following is the first Indian to get an Oscar Award?

solution.content: Bhanu Athaiya. She was a costume designer in more than 100 movies and won an Oscar award in 1983 for the movie 'Gandhi'.

question.content: In which Olympic games did India win the gold medal in men's hockey, for the first time post-independence?

solution.content: London. The Indian field hockey team defeated the British team to win the country's first gold medal at the 1948 Summer Olympics.

question.content: Which of the following was the first language conferred with the status of Classical Language in India?

solution.content: Tamil. Six languages in India namely Tamil, Telugu, Sanskrit, Kannada, Malayalam and Odia have been given the status of classical language.

question.content: Which state became the first fully organic farming state in India in 2016?

solution.content: Sikkim. Lakshadweep is second in organic farming.

question.content: Who among the following was the first Finance Minister of independent India?

solution.content: RK Shanmukham Chetty was the first Finance Minister of independent India when the country's first budget was tabled in Parliament on 26 November 1947.

question.content: Who among the following was the first-ever Indian to receive the Bharat Ratna award?

solution.content: Chandrasekhara Venkata Raman. Bharat Ratna was introduced on 2nd January 1954. The First 3 persons to receive Bharat Ratna (1954)- C Rajagopalachari, S Radhakrishnan & CV Raman.

question.content: Which country launched the first artificial satellite Sputnik 1?

solution.content: USSR. It was launched into an elliptical low Earth orbit by the USSR on 4 October 1957 as part of the Soviet space program. Launch site: Baikonur Rocket: Sputnik 8K71PS.

question.content: Who among the following has been the first sportsperson to receive the Padma Shri award from the Government of India?

solution.content: Balbir Singh Dosanjh. Padma Shri (1957). He wrote two books: his autobiography The Golden Hat Trick (1977) and The Golden Yardstick: In Quest of Hockey Excellence (2008).

question.content: Who among the following was the first woman commando trainer in India?

solution.content: Dr. Seema Rao. India's first female jawan in the Indian army is Shanti Tigga. The first woman officer in the Indian Air Force, Vijayalakshmi Ramanan. Punita Arora was the first woman in the Indian Armed Forces to be promoted to a three-star rank.

question.content: What was the name of the first artificial satellite launched by India in 1975?

solution.content: Aryabhatta. Rohini was India's first satellite launched from an Indian-made launch vehicle.

question.content: Who among the following was the first Indian to win a seat in the House of Commons?

solution.content: Dadabhai Naoroji. The House of Commons is the lower house (democratically elected house) of the Parliament of the United Kingdom.

question.content: Who among the following is the first-ever woman fighter pilot to have taken part at a Republic Day Parade?

solution.content: Bhawna Kanth. She was declared as the first combat pilot along with two of her cohorts Mohana Singh and Avani Chaturvedi.

question.content: Who Director-General Survey of India? was the first of Archaeological

solution.content: Alexander Cunningham. ASI is an Indian government agency responsible for archaeological research and the conservation and preservation of cultural monuments in the country.

question.content: In which of the following countries was the first hockey association formed?

solution.content: The UK (1876). India has recently won a bronze medal in the 2020 Tokyo Olympics in Men's Hockey Title.

question.content: Who among the following was the first player from the Indian subcontinent to play for a European Football club (Celtic FC)?

solution.content: Mohammed Salim. The Celtic Football Club is a Scottish professional football club based in Glasgow, which plays in the Scottish Premiership.

question.content: In which of the following years was the first rocket launched in India?

solution.content: 1963. The launchpad for the first rocket 'RH200' was Thumba Balasore and took off from Thumba near Thiruvananthapuram.

question.content: Who among the following was appointed as the first woman Chairperson of BCCC (Broadcasting Content Complaints Council) by IBF (Indian Broadcasting Foundation)?

solution.content: Justice Gita Mittal. She has also served as the first woman Chief Justice of Jammu & Kashmir High Court.

question.content: When was the First Law Commission set up in independent India?

solution.content: а) 1955. The first Law Commission was established during the British Raj era in 1834 by the Charter Act of 1833. It was presided by Lord Macaulay. After that, three more Commissions were established in pre-independent India.

question.content: Which of the following satellites is India's first Earth imaging satellite in a geostationary orbit?

solution.content: GISAT-1. Starting with IRS-1A in 1988, ISRO has launched 41 operational remote sensing satellites.

question.content: Who among the following became the first Lokpal of India?

solution.content: Pinaki Chandra Ghose. The Lokpal has jurisdiction over the central government to inquire into allegations of corruption against its public functionaries and for matters connected to corruption.

question.content: In which year did India host the Commonwealth Games?

solution.content: In 2010, India hosted the Commonwealth Games. The event was first held in 1930, and with the exception of 1942 and 1946, has taken place every four years since then.

question.content: Which of the following was the first High Court established in India?

solution.content: The Calcutta High Court is the oldest high court in the country, established on 1 July 1862.

question.content: In which state of India does the sunrise first appear?

solution.content: Dong village in Arunachal Pradesh, which is known as the easternmost village in India.

question.content: What is the name of the first crude oil pipeline constructed in India?

solution.content: Naharkatia- Nunmati Barauni Pipeline. The pipeline between Naharkatia and Nunmati became operational in 1962 and between Nunmati and Barauni in 1964.

question.content: Who is the only Indian to have won the United Nations Award in the field of human rights?

solution.content: Baba Amte is the only Indian to have won the United Nations Award in the field of human rights in 1988.

question.content: Who was the first Asian player to win the Junior Wimbledon's Boys singles title?

solution.content: Ramanathan Krishnan was the first Asian tennis player to win the boy's singles title at Wimbledon Championship 1954 beating Ashley Cooper of Australia in the finals.

question.content: Who was India's first Chief of Defence Staff?

solution.content: General Bipin Rawat was India's first Chief of Defence Staff.

question.content: What is the name of the first research station in Antarctica built by the Government of India?

solution.content: Dakshin Gangotri was the first scientific base station of India situated in the Antarctic established in 1983.

question.content: The first Backward Classes Commission of India was headed by_.

solution.content: Kaka Kalelkar. The first Backward Classes Commission of India was set up by a Presidential Order in 1953 under the chairmanship of Kaka Kalelkar.

question.content: Name the first female amputee to climb Mount Everest.

solution.content: Arunima Sinha is the world's first female amputee to climb Mount Everest in 2013. She is also the first female amputee to climb Mount Vinson, the highest peak of Antarctica. is

question.content: Who is the first General of the Indian Army, whose retirement day celebrated as the 'Armed Forces Veterans Day' every year?

solution.content: General K.M. Cariappa. Armed Forces Veterans Day is observed each year on 14th January as a mark of respect and recognition of the services rendered by Field Marshal KM Cariappa, the first Indian Commander -in-Chief of the Indian Armed Forces who retired on 14 Jan 1953.

question.content: On which lake is the world's only floating post office situated?

solution.content: Dal Lake. The floating post office is located in the beautiful city of Srinagar in Kashmir, amidst picturesque snow-clad mountains on a huge houseboat in Dal Lake.
